meta.title: Form Tags
meta.description: Custom tagged input component, with ability for user to override rendering

props.description: Array of current tags. This is the v-model
Sets the value of the 'name' attribute on the form control. When set, creates a hidden input for each tag
ID to apply to the new tag input element. If not provided, a unique ID will be auto generated
Class (or classes) to apply to the new tag input element
Additional attributes to apply to the new tag input element
Text for the built in 'Add' button. Slot `add-button-text' takes precedence
Applies one of the Bootstrap theme color variants to the 'Add' button
Applies one of the Bootstrap theme color variants to the tags
Class (or classes) to apply to the tags
Makes the built in tags have a pill appearance
The value of the 'aria-label' attribute on the remove button in the tag
Optional tag validator method. Passed a single argument of tag being added. Should return 'true' if the tag passes validation, or 'false' if the tag cannot be added
Validate (duplicate, invalid) tags as the user types. Default is to validate only when a tag is being added. If a 'tag-validator' is not provided, only duplicate tags will be detected
When set, enables removal of last tag in tags when user presses delete and the input is empty
When set, disables adding the tag on the input's 'change' event
When set, disables adding the tag on the input's 'keydown.enter' event
When set, disables the focus styling of the component root element

slots.name: add-button-text
slots.description: Content to place in the built in  'Add' button. Takes precedence over the 'add-button-text' prop

slots.name: default
slots.description: Slot to override the default rendering of the tags component

scope.description: Array of tags to render
Object of attributes to apply to native input elements via 'v-bind="inputAttrs"'
Object of event handlers to apply to native input elements via 'v-on="inputHandlers"'
ID to add to the new tag input element. Defaults to prop 'input-id'. If not provided a unique ID is auto-generated. Also available via 'inputAttrs.id'
Class (or classes) to apply to the new tag input element. Value of the 'input-class' prop
Method to remove a tag. Accepts one argument which is the tag value to remove
Method to add a new tag. Assumes the tag is the value of the input, but optionally accepts one argument which is the tag value to be added
Array of invalid tag(s) that could not be added. Requires a validator function via the 'tag-validator' prop
Will be true if the input has invalid tag(s). Requires a validator function via the 'tag-validator' prop
Array of duplicate tag(s) that could not be added
Will be true if the user has attempted to add duplicate tag(s)
If the component is in the disabled state. Value of the 'disabled' prop
The contextual state of the component. Value of the 'state' prop. Possible values are true, false or null
The value of the 'size' prop
The value of the 'separator' prop
The value of the 'placeholder' prop
ARIA label for the remove button on tags. Value of the 'tag-remove-label' prop
Value of the `tag-pills` prop
Value of the 'tag-variant' prop
Class (or classes) to apply to the tag elements. Value of the 'tag-class' prop
Value of the 'add-button-text' prop
Value of the 'add-button-variant' prop

events.description: Emitted when the tags changes. Updates the v-model
Emitted when tags are added or could not be added

args.description: Array of new tag(s) added. Will be zero length if no tags added.
Array of tag(s) that were not added because they did not pass validation. Will be zero length if no invalid tags.
Array of tag(s) that were not added because they would be a duplicate tag. Will be zero length if no duplicate tags.

components.description: Helper component for custom rending of tags in tagged input

props.description: Value to place in the 'title' attribute of the tag. Will also be used for the tag content if no default slot provided
Makes the tag have a pill appearance
The value of the 'aria-label' attribute on the remove button in the tag

events.description: Emitted when the remove button is clicked
